title: Riak Is Going To Have A Huge September
description:
September 07, 2011

In short, September is going to be a huge month for Riak. The 1.0 release will be dropping later this month and Basho and the Riak Community have lined up a string of events throughout the month to coincide with this momentous occasion.

So, without further verbiage, here is the rundown on what’s happening with Riak in the month of September. (And if I missed something, let me know in the comments and I’ll make sure to add it.)

Enjoy, and thanks for being a part of Riak.

(And if you want to stay up to date on the latest with Riak 1.0, go join the Mailing List if you haven’t already. You won’t regret it.)

Mark
Community Manager

Riak 1.0 Preview Meetup – San Francisco

September 8

Basho Developer Advocate Dan Reverri will be delivering an in-depth presentation to the the San Francisco Riak Meetup covering all the new features and functionality coming in Riak 1.0 tomorrow night at the Formspring Offices.

There are still a few seats left for this. Register here.

Riak 1.0 Preview Meetup – New York

September 8

A few hours before Dan takes the stage in San Francisco, Basho Developer Advocate Sean Cribbs will be giving his talk on the Riak 1.0 Release to the NYC Riak User Group, being held at the SonarHQ offices.

Upon writing, there are still a few seats available. Registration and details here.

Storage Decisions – New York

September 19 – 20

Basho CEO Don Rippert will be taking the stage at the Storage Decisions event to talk about Riak and Big Data. We’ll also be sponsoring, so stop by and see us if you’re planning to be here.

It looks like there are still tickets available for anyone interested in attending.

Strange Loop – St. Louis

September 18 – 20

Strange Loop is going to go down as one of the banner conferences of 2011, and it’s for this reason that Basho couldn’t be prouder to be gold sponsors of the event. In addition to the sponsorship, Sean Cribbs will be giving a talk called Wrap Your SQL Head Around Riak MapReduce. And the community will be representing in a big way at Strange Loop: Kresten Krab Thorup, CTO of Trifork, will also be giving a talk called Bringing Riak to the Mobile Platform; attendees will also have a chance to see Susan Potter talking about using riak_core to build distributed systems (h/t to kenny for pointing this out).

Sadly, if you don’t have a ticket to this one already, you’re out of luck; it has been sold out for a few weeks now. That said, if you’re planning to attend, we’ll see you there.

Riak 1.0 Release Party – New York

September 21

One day after Strange Loop concludes, we’ll be in NYC for the first Riak 1.0 Release Party (we’re working on getting at least one more on the calendar). This is going to be an all out celebration of the new Riak release, and if you’re planning to be in or around NYC on this day, you have no reason not to attend.

Details and registration here.

Riak 1.0 Webinar – Anywhere

September 21

Basho CTO Justin Sheehy and Principal Architect Andy Gross will be holding a webinar to preview and discuss the features and functionality coming in Riak 1.0. They are also planning to touch on what is in store for Riak post 1.0. So this is something you’re going to want to attend.

More details and registration here.

Scaling at Showyou – San Francisco

September 26

John Mullerleile and Kyle Kingsbury are giving a talk on the high-availability technologies they use to scale Showyou. In addition to covering their Riak usage in-depth, they’ll also touch on Solr, distributed queuing, and metrics, and present some new open-source tools they’ve built to tackle various problem.

Details and registration here.

Surge – Baltimore

September 26 – 28

Several members of the Basho Team will be giving a half-day Riak training at Surge. Surge is put on by the awesome team at OmniTI and, if you take one look at the Speaker’s page, it should be pretty apparent why we’re honored to sponsor the event.

At the of time writing, tickets are still available. I wouldn’t expect this to last too long.

RubyConf – New Orleans

September 29 – October 1

The ever-present Sean Cribbs will be representing Basho at RubyConf in New Orleans. Sean’s giving a talk on his Ruby port of Webmachine, the “REST toolkit” that forms the foundation for Riak’s HTTP interface and is an incredibly-powerful piece of software in its own right.

This event is sold out, but if you’re attending be sure to find Sean. He’s usually equipped with Riak SWAG and strong opinions on various pieces of database technology.
